description: A health insurance plan that has a lower monthly premium, but requires you to pay more of your health care costs up front—at least $1,350 for an individual and $2,700 for a family—before your insurance starts to pay its share. An HDHP can be combined with a health savings account (HSA), which you can use to cover certain medical expenses tax-free.
title: High-Deductible Health Plan (HDHP)
